title: Authors and Citation
text: Rade G, Tyler-Penny M, Ting J (2023). actLifer: Creating Actuarial Life Tables. R package version 0.0.0.9000,  https://g-rade.github.io/act_lifer/, https://g-rade.github.io/actLifer/, https://github.com/g-rade/act_lifer.
code: @Manual{,   title = {actLifer: Creating Actuarial Life Tables},   author = {Grace Rade and Maeve Tyler-Penny and Julia Ting},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000,  https://g-rade.github.io/act_lifer/, https://g-rade.github.io/actLifer/},   url = {https://github.com/g-rade/act_lifer}, }

title: Creating Actuarial Life Tables
text: actLifer package contains functions create life table based mortality data, ultimately calculates life expectancy data annual deaths given ages/age groups. package also contains mortality data CDC wonder. package useful actuaries, epidemiologists, data scientists working mortality data.

title: Creating Actuarial Life Tables
text: can install development version actLifer GitHub : can install reslease version actLifer CRAN :

title: Creating Actuarial Life Tables
code: library(actLifer) #> Loading required package: dplyr #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  ## Take a look at the mortality2 data fram head(mortality2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   age_group deaths population #>   <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl> #> 1 < 1 year   23161    3970145 #> 2 1 year      1568    3995008 #> 3 2 years     1046    3992154 #> 4 3 years      791    3982074 #> 5 4 years      640    3987656 #> 6 5 years      546    4032515  ## Use the lifetable function to make a custom life table with just ## CentralDeathRate, PropToSurvive, and LifeExpectancy by setting includeAllSteps = FALSE  lifetable(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths", FALSE, TRUE, TRUE) #> # A tibble: 85 × 6 #>    age_group deaths population CentralDeathRate PropToSurvive LifeExpectancy #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>            <dbl>         <dbl>          <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145         0.00583          1               75.9 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008         0.000392         0.994           75.3 #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154         0.000262         0.994           74.4 #>  4 3 years      791    3982074         0.000199         0.994           73.4 #>  5 4 years      640    3987656         0.000160         0.993           72.4 #>  6 5 years      546    4032515         0.000135         0.993           71.4 #>  7 6 years      488    4029655         0.000121         0.993           70.4 #>  8 7 years      511    4029991         0.000127         0.993           69.4 #>  9 8 years      483    4159114         0.000116         0.993           68.4 #> 10 9 years      462    4178524         0.000111         0.993           67.4 #> # ℹ 75 more rows   ## Or show everything by setting includeAllSteps=TRUE, includeCDR=TRUE, and includePS=TRUE which are the default values lifetable(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 11 #>    age_group deaths population CentralDeathRate ConditionalProbDeath #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>            <dbl>                <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145         0.00583              0.00582  #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008         0.000392             0.000392 #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154         0.000262             0.000262 #>  4 3 years      791    3982074         0.000199             0.000199 #>  5 4 years      640    3987656         0.000160             0.000160 #>  6 5 years      546    4032515         0.000135             0.000135 #>  7 6 years      488    4029655         0.000121             0.000121 #>  8 7 years      511    4029991         0.000127             0.000127 #>  9 8 years      483    4159114         0.000116             0.000116 #> 10 9 years      462    4178524         0.000111             0.000111 #> # ℹ 75 more rows #> # ℹ 6 more variables: ConditionalProbLife <dbl>, NumberToSurvive <dbl>, #> #   PropToSurvive <dbl>, PersonYears <dbl>, TotalYears <dbl>, #> #   LifeExpectancy <dbl>

title: Creating Actuarial Life Tables
text: Grace Rade Maeve Tyler-Penny Julia Ting

title: Central Death Rate — central_death_rate
text: Adds new column called CentralDeathRate dataset input. column represents central death rate age group - deaths/population.

title: Central Death Rate — central_death_rate
Central Death Rate — central_death_rate
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable, age age grouping variable, must categorical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths midyear number deaths age group, must numeric

title: Central Death Rate — central_death_rate
text: Data frame input added CentralDeathRate column.

title: Central Death Rate — central_death_rate
code: # This function adds a CentralDeathRate column to the dataset central_death_rate(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 4 #>    age_group deaths population CentralDeathRate #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>            <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145         0.00583  #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008         0.000392 #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154         0.000262 #>  4 3 years      791    3982074         0.000199 #>  5 4 years      640    3987656         0.000160 #>  6 5 years      546    4032515         0.000135 #>  7 6 years      488    4029655         0.000121 #>  8 7 years      511    4029991         0.000127 #>  9 8 years      483    4159114         0.000116 #> 10 9 years      462    4178524         0.000111 #> # ℹ 75 more rows

what: Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
title: Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
text: Adds new column called ConditionalProbDeath dataset input. column represents probability death given age group age group. words, probability person given age group die next birthday.

title: Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable age age grouping variable, must cateogrical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths number deaths age group, must numeric

title: Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
text: Data frame input added column, ConditionalProbDeath.

title: Conditional Probability of Death at Age x — conditional_death_prob
code: # This function will add a ConditionalProbDeath column to the dataset conditional_death_prob(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 4 #>    age_group deaths population ConditionalProbDeath #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145             0.00582  #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008             0.000392 #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154             0.000262 #>  4 3 years      791    3982074             0.000199 #>  5 4 years      640    3987656             0.000160 #>  6 5 years      546    4032515             0.000135 #>  7 6 years      488    4029655             0.000121 #>  8 7 years      511    4029991             0.000127 #>  9 8 years      483    4159114             0.000116 #> 10 9 years      462    4178524             0.000111 #> # ℹ 75 more rows

what: Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
title: Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
text: Adds new column called ConditionalProbLife dataset input. ConditionalProbLife column contains probabilities surviving given age group. words, probability someone surviving next birthday.

title: Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable age age grouping variable, must cateogrical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths number deaths age group, must numeric

title: Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
text: Dataset input added columns ConditionalProbDeath ConditionalProbLife. words, "steps" conditional probability survival.

title: Conditional Probability of Survival at Age x — conditional_life_prob
code: # This function will add the ConditionalProbDeath and ConditionalProbLife columns # to the dataset conditional_life_prob(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 5 #>    age_group deaths population ConditionalProbDeath ConditionalProbLife #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl>               <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145             0.00582                0.994 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008             0.000392               1.00  #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154             0.000262               1.00  #>  4 3 years      791    3982074             0.000199               1.00  #>  5 4 years      640    3987656             0.000160               1.00  #>  6 5 years      546    4032515             0.000135               1.00  #>  7 6 years      488    4029655             0.000121               1.00  #>  8 7 years      511    4029991             0.000127               1.00  #>  9 8 years      483    4159114             0.000116               1.00  #> 10 9 years      462    4178524             0.000111               1.00  #> # ℹ 75 more rows

title: Error Handling Function — input_check
text: Checks inputs data, age, pop, deaths make sure valid.

title: Error Handling Function — input_check
Error Handling Function — input_check
text: data data frame input upper function age age string character input upper function pop pop string character input upper function deaths deaths string character input upper function

title: Error Handling Function — input_check
text: data frame numeric pop deaths columns

what: Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
title: Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
text: Adds new column called LifeExpectancy dataset input. LifeExpectancy many years expect person age x live beyond current age.

title: Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable, age age grouping variable, must categorical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths midyear number deaths age group, must numeric

title: Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
text: Dataset input added columns: ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, NumberToSurvive, PersonYears, TotalYears, LifeExpectancy.

title: Life Expectancy of Age x — life_expectancy
code: # This function will add the ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, # NumberToSurvive, PropToSurvive, PersonYears, TotalYears, and LifeExpectancy # columns to the dataset. # This will be a full lifetable life_expectancy(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 10 #>    age_group deaths population ConditionalProbDeath ConditionalProbLife #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl>               <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145             0.00582                0.994 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008             0.000392               1.00  #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154             0.000262               1.00  #>  4 3 years      791    3982074             0.000199               1.00  #>  5 4 years      640    3987656             0.000160               1.00  #>  6 5 years      546    4032515             0.000135               1.00  #>  7 6 years      488    4029655             0.000121               1.00  #>  8 7 years      511    4029991             0.000127               1.00  #>  9 8 years      483    4159114             0.000116               1.00  #> 10 9 years      462    4178524             0.000111               1.00  #> # ℹ 75 more rows #> # ℹ 5 more variables: NumberToSurvive <dbl>, PropToSurvive <dbl>, #> #   PersonYears <dbl>, TotalYears <dbl>, LifeExpectancy <dbl>

title: Lifetable Function — lifetable
text: Gives user control lifetable compared life_expectancy() function. Allows user add central death rate proportion surviving age x. Allows user omit accessory columns used calculate life expectancy.

title: Lifetable Function — lifetable
code: lifetable(   data,   age,   pop,   deaths,   includeAllSteps = TRUE,   includeCDR = TRUE,   includePS = TRUE,   ... )

title: Lifetable Function — lifetable
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable, age age grouping variable, must categorical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths midyear number deaths age group, must numeric includeAllSteps false, include proportion surviving age x life expectancy age x includeCDR true, include central death rate age group includePS true, include proportion surviving age group ... optional grouping variables (can race, gender, etc.)

title: Lifetable Function — lifetable
text: Lifetable

title: Lifetable Function — lifetable
code: # Running lifetable() and choosing not to include CentralDeathRate and # ProportionToSurvive (optional columns) in the output dataset  lifetable(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths", FALSE, TRUE, TRUE) #> # A tibble: 85 × 6 #>    age_group deaths population CentralDeathRate PropToSurvive LifeExpectancy #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>            <dbl>         <dbl>          <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145         0.00583          1               75.9 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008         0.000392         0.994           75.3 #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154         0.000262         0.994           74.4 #>  4 3 years      791    3982074         0.000199         0.994           73.4 #>  5 4 years      640    3987656         0.000160         0.993           72.4 #>  6 5 years      546    4032515         0.000135         0.993           71.4 #>  7 6 years      488    4029655         0.000121         0.993           70.4 #>  8 7 years      511    4029991         0.000127         0.993           69.4 #>  9 8 years      483    4159114         0.000116         0.993           68.4 #> 10 9 years      462    4178524         0.000111         0.993           67.4 #> # ℹ 75 more rows

what: The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
title: The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
text: Adds new column called NumberToSurvive dataset input. NumberToSurvive represents number people living beginning given age interval, using arbitrary 100,000 people first age group table.

title: The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable, age age grouping variable, must categorical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths midyear number deaths age group, must numeric

title: The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
text: Dataset input added columns: ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, NumberToSurvive.

title: The Number of People to Survive to Age x — number_to_survive
code: # This function will add the ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, and # NumberToSurvive columns to the dataset number_to_survive(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 6 #>    age_group deaths population ConditionalProbDeath ConditionalProbLife #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl>               <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145             0.00582                0.994 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008             0.000392               1.00  #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154             0.000262               1.00  #>  4 3 years      791    3982074             0.000199               1.00  #>  5 4 years      640    3987656             0.000160               1.00  #>  6 5 years      546    4032515             0.000135               1.00  #>  7 6 years      488    4029655             0.000121               1.00  #>  8 7 years      511    4029991             0.000127               1.00  #>  9 8 years      483    4159114             0.000116               1.00  #> 10 9 years      462    4178524             0.000111               1.00  #> # ℹ 75 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: NumberToSurvive <dbl>

what: Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
title: Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
text: Adds new column called PersonYears dataset input. PersonYears represents number years lived age x based number surviving age x.

title: Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
text: data mortality dataset, includes age grouping variable, age age grouping variable, must categorical pop Population age group, must numeric deaths midyear number deaths age group, must numeric

title: Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
text: Dataset input added columns: ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, NumberToSurvive, PropToSurvive, PersonYears.

title: Person Years Lived at Age x — person_years
code: # This function will add the ConditionalProbDeath, ConditionalProbLife, # NumberToSurvive, PropToSurvive, and PersonYears columns to the dataset person_years(mortality2, "age_group", "population", "deaths") #> # A tibble: 85 × 8 #>    age_group deaths population ConditionalProbDeath ConditionalProbLife #>    <chr>      <dbl>      <dbl>                <dbl>               <dbl> #>  1 < 1 year   23161    3970145             0.00582                0.994 #>  2 1 year      1568    3995008             0.000392               1.00  #>  3 2 years     1046    3992154             0.000262               1.00  #>  4 3 years      791    3982074             0.000199               1.00  #>  5 4 years      640    3987656             0.000160               1.00  #>  6 5 years      546    4032515             0.000135               1.00  #>  7 6 years      488    4029655             0.000121               1.00  #>  8 7 years      511    4029991             0.000127               1.00  #>  9 8 years      483    4159114             0.000116               1.00  #> 10 9 years      462    4178524             0.000111               1.00  #> # ℹ 75 more rows #> # ℹ 3 more variables: NumberToSurvive <dbl>, PropToSurvive <dbl>, #> #   PersonYears <dbl>
